author: Aloysius Xavier Lopez
text:
Bad roads in the city are all set to be repaired by the Chennai Corporation. It is notable that many of these roads were re-laid only recently, spending huge sums of money, and they are still covered by the liability provision.

However, Corporation officials have decided not to invoke the provision and free these contractors of liability.

“At least 25 bus routes have been damaged within the liability period,” said a senior official of Chennai Corporation.

More than 180 bus routes were relaid for the global investors meet a few months ago. Thousands of interior roads were also relaid in 2015.

Not to invoke

liability clause

The official said the civic body would not invoke liability provisions against contractors, on account of the floods.

However, the Chennai Corporation is yet to release the data relating to quality of the newly relaid roads that had been damaged in the floods.

Former IAS Officer M. G. Devasahayam said the contractors who had carried out a shoddy work escaped due to the floods.
title: Reprieve for road contractors
